text:
Preparation Chill the watermelons. Place in the refrigerator for several hours prior to making the drink. Remove the watermelon from the refrigerator. Cut each watermelon in half. Cut off the rind and remove the seeds. Making the Drink Place small batches of the fresh watermelon in the blender. Blend until smooth. Sometimes you may need to add a little water to help the consistency. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8b\/Make-Watermelon-Gin-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Watermelon-Gin-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/8\/8b\/Make-Watermelon-Gin-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/aid4007830-v4-728px-Make-Watermelon-Gin-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Drain into a pitcher. Then continue with the next batch until all batches have been blended. Add the gin to the pitcher. Stir thoroughly to combine the watermelon and gin. Serving Add crushed ice to each glass. Pour the watermelon gin into each glass. Add a sprig of mint and a thin slice of watermelon to the top of the glass. Serve immediately.
